its wonderful all the characters are very charming and witty the puzzles get a little difficult but its nothing a walkthrough cant help its a little old but all the art and animation still holds up beautifully great game
its a lovely game
use a walkthrough ok damn near every single puzzle is a pain in the ass
really enjoyed the adventure game it was cool to see and it isnt something i had nostalgia for so my first playthrough was fresh

absolutely wonderful game with the perfect soundtrack very film noir but also funny and witty with the mexicanaztec themed style and background bringing the romanticism of death to life for those sentimental for the 90s it is a beautiful trip back in time

such a great game love the world and its characters some puzzles have very obscure solutions that required some hints to get through also a bit of jank still remains in the remastered control system overall very happy to have this playable on modern hardware
a classic you dont want to miss
great remaster

puzzles are very challenging to solve in order to progress through the story but well worth the while once you solve them the characters are very comedic and comical as well such a vibrant and colorful story filled with lots of references of mexican culture too five out of five for me feels pretty nostalgic to play this one

so dense and lush and packed with so many fascinating oddball characters and designs that completely wowed me on top of that its just such a fantastic story that everyone should experience once in a lifetime so so so incredible hell yes
love this title brought me back to the classic point and click adventure games i grew up with the remaster looks and sounds great

i cannot recommend this game enough i havent showed it to a single person who hasnt loved it and this includes friends who either never played an adventure game before or just werent into the genre hilarious lovable characters an engaging story absolutely stunning locations puzzles that are satisfying to figure out even at their hardest and one of the better endings for an adventure game the absolute apex of the genre to this day if you ask me
no other game has put you in role death in mexico interfrace ui is a bit odd even for point and click but you will get by
the last classic point and click that released in an era where no one wanted them anymore please do yourself a favor and play it
its fine

what a joy to play this game again i remember first playing this game many moons ago on a windows 95 pc with an intel pentium mmx my god good days its nice to see some of these old gems make it onto modern machines rather than just left to gather dust in the archives to be forgotten thankyou lucasarts for bringing this back what a nostalgic trip down memory lane and for lovingly remastering this classic gem i hope you all agree
great writing voice acting and story a classic for the point and click adventure genre

cheese rating 96100   grim fandango is one of the most unique and gripping stories ive experienced the characters are memorablefeel integral to the story the art style is timeless the soundtrack fits perfectly and the writing ties everything together the only drawbacks are that some puzzles have super obscure solutions and the controls can feel dated at times if you can get past the oldschool clunkyness then this is something everyone should play once
the vibes in this games are b unmatched b just i chefs kiss i wish i wouldve gotten it sooner
i can see why this game is so beloved the puzzles are just the right amount of difficulty to keep you guessing for hours

i love these old storydriven adventure games and grim fandango is one of the best  the remaster is beautiful while staying true to the original the soundtrack is amazing and the story is so much fun  there are no minimaps waypoints or even a journal to track mission goals so just use a guide and treat it like an interactive movie and enjoy your adventure through the land of the dead
filled with so much life for a land of the dead
game is good just like old times

classic
